Generation I.Red: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
Generation I.Yellow: Appears to be more active at night. It loves round and shiny things. It can't stop from picking them up.
Generation I.Stadium: Sleeps in the daytime. At night, its eyes glow as it happily collects coins, its favorite things.

Generation II.Gold: It is fascinated by round objects. It can't stop playing with them until it tires and falls asleep.
Generation II.Silver: It loves anything that shines. It especially adores coins that it picks up and secretly hoards.
Generation II.Crystal: It loves things that sparkle. When it sees a shiny object, the gold coin on its head shines too.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It is fascinated by round objects. It can't stop playing with them until it tires and falls asleep. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It loves anything that shines. It especially adores coins that it picks up and secretly hoards. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pok é mon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
Generation III.Sapphire: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pok é mon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
Generation III.Emerald: Meowth withdraw their sharp claws into their paws to silently sneak about. For some reason, this Pok é mon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
Generation III.FireRed: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

Generation IV.Diamond: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
Generation IV.Pearl: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
Generation IV.Platinum: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It is fascinated by round objects. It can't stop playing with them until it tires and falls asleep.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It loves anything that shines. It especially adores coins that it picks up and secretly hoards.

Generation V.Black: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
Generation V.White: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
Generation V.Black 2: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
Generation V.White 2: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

Generation VI.X: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
Generation VI.Y: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.

Generation VII.Sun: This Pokémon was not originally found in Alola. Human actions caused a surge in their numbers, and they went feral. They're prideful and crafty.
Generation VII.Moon: When its delicate pride is wounded, or when the gold coin on its forehead is dirtied, it flies into a hysterical rage.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It's impulsive, selfish, and fickle. It's very popular with some Trainers who like giving it the attention it needs.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: A royal house that flourished in the distant past brought it here from another region. Meowth is both selfish and prideful.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Highly intelligent and prideful, it's famously difficult to handle—but that's also a reason for its popularity.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Highly intelligent and prideful, it's famously difficult to handle—but that's also a reason for its popularity.

Generation VIII.Sword: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.
Generation VIII.Shield: These daring Pokémon have coins on their foreheads. Darker coins are harder, and harder coins garner more respect among Meowth.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is nocturnal by nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter as brightly as the shiny object.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It is nocturnal by nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter as brightly as the shiny object.

Generation IX.Scarlet: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.
Generation IX.Violet: It loves things that sparkle. When it sees a shiny object, the gold coin on its head shines, too.
